intro: Syrmatium biolettii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its foliage is often velvety and comes in various shades of green, while the flowers range from purple to white. Syrmatium biolettii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
